# Council of Ministers
## Decree-Law No. 62 of 2025
### Amending Certain Provisions of the Code of Criminal Procedures and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig>
### Issued by Law No. 17 of 1960

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> issued by Law No. 16 of 1960, and its amending laws,
- And the Code of Criminal Procedures and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig> issued by Law No. 17 of 1960, and its amending laws,
- And the Social Insurance Law <orig>قانون التأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> issued by Law No. 61 of 1976, and its amending laws,
- And the Code of Civil and Commercial Procedures <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig> issued by Decree-Law No. 38 of 1980, and its amending laws,
- And the Judicial Organization Law <orig>قانون تنظيم القضاء</orig> issued by Decree-Law No. 23 of 1990, and its amending laws,
- And Law No. 19 of 2000 regarding the Support of National Labor and Encouraging its Employment in Non-Governmental Entities <orig>دعم العمالة الوطنية وتشجيعها للعمل في الجهات غير الحكومية</orig>, amended by Law No. 32 of 2003,
- And Law No. 2 of 2014 regarding Electronic Transactions <orig>المعاملات الإلكترونية</orig>,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law:

### Article One
The texts of Articles (188 and 230) of the aforementioned Code of Criminal Procedures and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig> shall be replaced with the following two texts:

### Article (188)
The period for objection <orig>المعارضة</orig> is one week, commencing in misdemeanors from the date the absentee judgment is served on the convicted person. In felonies, it commences from the date of the convicted person's arrest if the judgment has not been served personally. If this period expires without the convicted person filing an objection, the judgment may only be appealed if it is subject to appeal.
The absentee judgment shall be served personally on the convicted person, or via email, or by any other modern communication means capable of storage and retrieval, in accordance with the conditions and controls stipulated in the aforementioned Code of Civil and Commercial Procedures <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.
If it is not possible to serve the judgment on the convicted person, the notification shall be delivered at their place of residence to any of their relatives or in-laws residing with them or to any of their followers. If none of them are found, or if those found refuse to receive the notification, the notification shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and affixed in prominent places in the area where it is located, and in a prominent place at their residence or workplace, and in any other place deemed appropriate for publication.

### Article (230)
If the convicted person fails to pay the fine imposed, it shall be collected through compulsory execution <orig>التنفيذ الجبري</orig> on their assets. The Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> may collect it through monthly deductions not exceeding one-quarter of the amount the convicted person receives as salary, wage, labor support, or retirement pension.
The President of the court that issued the judgment, or the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig> or their authorized representative, may, upon the request of the convicted person, order the installment payment of the fine amount or its postponement for a reasonable period, provided that justification is presented, provided that the full amount of the fine is paid within five years.

### Article Two
The Ministers – each within their jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force from the date of its publication.

Amir of Kuwait
Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>

Acting Prime Minister
Fahad Yusuf Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

Minister of Justice
Counselor / Nasser Yousef Mohammed Al-Sumait <orig>ناصر يوسف محمد السمييط</orig>

The substituted Article (230) <orig>المادة (230) المستبدلة</orig> included a provision to address the problem revealed by practical experience regarding the accumulation of criminally imposed fines, which has reached an extreme level, as these amounts have become a heavy burden that is difficult to collect in many cases. What exacerbated the problem is that the failure to collect these fines from convicted persons has resulted in a set of serious legal issues, most notably the statute of limitations for criminal cases <orig>تقادم الدعاوى الجزائية</orig> and the lapse of penalties due to the passage of time <orig>سقوط العقوبات بمضي المدة</orig>. These problems ultimately lead to the state losing its legitimate right to collect these amounts, even though these fines are a right enjoying a general privilege that the public treasury <orig>الخزانة العامة</orig> must collect for the benefit of the nation.
For this reason, the substituted text <orig>النص المستبدل</orig> came to specify more effective procedures for collecting criminal fines. It stipulated that if the convicted person fails to pay the imposed fine, it shall be collected through compulsory enforcement <orig>التنفيذ الجبري</orig> on their assets. It also permitted the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> to collect it through monthly deductions not exceeding a quarter of the amount the convicted person receives as salary, wage, employment support <orig>دعم عمالة</orig>, or retirement pension <orig>معاش تقاعدي</orig>. Furthermore, this text granted the authority to the head of the court <orig>رئيس المحكمة</orig> that issued the judgment, or to the Public Prosecutor <orig>النائب العام</orig> or their authorized representative, to order the installment payment or deferral of the adjudicated amount for a reasonable period upon the request of the convicted person, provided they present justification for it, with the full adjudicated amount not to be delayed beyond five years.
This ensures, on the one hand, that these amounts do not accumulate, and on the other hand, prevents the loss of state rights.

The Code of Criminal Procedures and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig> is considered one of the fundamental pillars upon which criminal justice <orig>العدالة الجنائية</orig> is based in any society. As such, it is not merely a collection of abstract legal texts, but rather the backbone that carries justice, establishes it in people's minds, and makes it effective in their lives.
While law in general holds great importance in preserving rights and regulating relations between individuals, the Code of Criminal Procedures <orig>قانون الإجراءات الجزائية</orig> acquires special significance because it addresses the mechanism for applying these laws on the ground and formulates the method of applying justice with legal tools that ensure every individual can easily and readily access their rights.
Perhaps one of the greatest roles played by the Code of Criminal Procedures and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig> is its emphasis on state sovereignty <orig>سيادة الدولة</orig>. The state cannot achieve true sovereignty unless it has the ability to enforce its laws, execute its judgments, and set the foundations of justice in motion to reach every rights-holder at all times and in all places.
From this, it can be said that the Code of Criminal Procedures and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig> is the state's tool for imposing its sovereignty everywhere, and it is the guarantor of embodying the idea of true justice, which does not stop at the texts of the law alone, but finds its reflection in the actual implementation of those texts.
Nevertheless, the practical application of laws is not without challenges. Practical experiences have shown the need to keep pace with developments in communication methods, especially in light of the successful implementation of "electronic notification" <orig>الإعلان الإلكتروني</orig> in notifying lawsuits and appeals in accordance with the provisions of the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig> issued by Decree-Law No. 38 of 1980 <orig>المرسوم بالقانون رقم 38 لسنة 1980</orig>. Furthermore, there are numerous problems related to the collection of criminally imposed fines, which have become a significant obstacle to achieving social and financial justice.
And since the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> was issued on 10/5/2024, and Article (4) thereof stipulated that laws shall be issued by decree-laws <orig>مراسيم بقوانين</orig>, therefore, the present draft decree-law <orig>مشروع المرسوم بقانون الماثل</orig> was prepared, and its first article stipulated the replacement of Articles (188, 230) of the Code of Criminal Procedures and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig> issued by Law No. 17

Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait and the Austrian Federal Government regarding
Visa Exemption for Holders of Diplomatic
and Special Passports for the State of Kuwait and Holders of
Diplomatic and Service Passports for the Republic of Austria
</header>

They have agreed as follows:

### Article 1
(1) Citizens of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, who hold a valid biometric diplomatic or special passport, are not required to obtain a visa to enter the territory of the Republic of Austria <orig>جمهورية النمسا</orig>, and may stay for a period not exceeding 90 (ninety) days within 180 (one hundred and eighty) days, calculated from the day of first entry, either into the territory of the Republic of Austria <orig>جمهورية النمسا</orig> or the territory of any other state to which the Schengen Convention of 19 June 1990, implementing the Schengen Agreement of 14 June 1985 on the gradual abolition of checks at their common borders, is applicable.
(2) Citizens of the Republic of Austria <orig>جمهورية النمسا</orig>, who hold a valid biometric diplomatic or service passport, are not required to obtain a visa to enter the territory of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and may stay for a period not exceeding 90 (ninety) days within 180 (one hundred and eighty) days from the date of entry.

### Article 2
Holders of valid biometric diplomatic or service passports for the Republic of Austria <orig>جمهورية النمسا</orig> and holders of valid biometric diplomatic or special passports for the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> may enter the territory of the other Party and exit from any point authorized for this purpose by the competent immigration authorities, without any restrictions except those stipulated in the provisions of security, immigration, customs, health entry, and other provisions that may legally apply to holders of ordinary passports.

### Article 3
The provisions of Article 1 of this Agreement do not apply to persons who plan to stay in the territory of the other Party for a period longer than that stipulated in Article 1, or who intend to obtain employment there.

### Article 4
Citizens of either Party who enjoy privileges and immunities in accordance with international law and hold their identity card issued by the host state, do not require a visa or residence permit to stay in the territory of that Party.

- Having reviewed the Constitution,

- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
We have decreed the following:

### Article One
Approval of the Agreement between the Government of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and the Austrian Federal Government <orig>الحكومة الاتحادية النمساوية</orig> regarding Visa Exemption for Holders of Diplomatic and Special Passports for the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and Holders of Diplomatic and Service Passports for the Republic of Austria <orig>جمهورية النمسا</orig>, signed in New York City on 26/9/2024, the texts of which are attached to this Decree.

### Article Two
Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Article 5
(1) The two Parties shall exchange, through diplomatic channels, samples of passports in accordance with Article 1 of this Agreement used by either Party within 30 (thirty) days after the signing of this Agreement. Each Party shall provide the other Party with a sample of any new diplomatic, service, or special passport if it is changed at least 30 (thirty) days before the issuance of such passports.
(2) Both Parties shall duly inform each other of any amendment introduced to their respective national laws and regulations concerning the issuance of passports.
(3) If a national of either Party loses their valid passport referred to in Article 1 of this Agreement in the territory of the other Party, they shall inform the competent authorities of the host State.
The diplomatic or consular mission shall issue a new passport or travel document to the said national and inform the competent authorities of the host State.

Article 6
(1) This Agreement shall not exempt nationals of either Party from the obligation to respect the laws and regulations of the other Party concerning the entry, stay, and exit of foreigners.
(2) Both Parties reserve the right to refuse entry or shorten the duration of stay of persons considered undesirable or who endanger public peace, order, health, or national security.

Article 7
Either Party may temporarily suspend this Agreement for reasons related to public order, protection of national security, public health, illegal immigration, conflict of interest in the field of human rights and fundamental freedoms, or non-cooperation in the field of readmission. The other Party shall be immediately notified of the commencement of the suspension, as well as its cancellation, through diplomatic channels.

Article 8
Any dispute that may arise from the application and/or interpretation of this Agreement shall be settled through diplomatic channels and through consultations or negotiations.

Article 9
This Agreement may be amended by mutual written consent of both Parties at any time. Amendments shall enter into force in accordance with the procedures stipulated in Article 10 (1) of this Agreement.

Article (10)
(1) This Agreement shall enter into force from the date of receipt of the last written notification through diplomatic channels, by which the Parties inform each other of the completion of the constitutional procedures for its entry into force.
(2) This Agreement shall remain in force for a period of five years from the date of its entry into force and shall be automatically renewed for similar periods, unless one Party notifies the other Party in writing and through diplomatic channels of its intention to terminate this Agreement 6 months prior to its expiry date.
(3) The termination of this Agreement shall not affect the validity or duration of any specific agreements, projects, and activities undertaken pursuant to this Agreement.

Done in the city of New York <orig>نيويورك</orig> on September 26, 2024 AD, in two original copies in Arabic, German, and English, each being equally authentic. In case of divergence in interpretation, the English text shall prevail.

For
The Government of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>
Abdullah Ali Al-Yahya <orig>عبد الله علي اليحيا</orig>
Minister of Foreign Affairs

The Federal Government of Austria <orig>الحكومة الاتحادية النمساوية</orig>
Alexander Schallenberg <orig>الكسندر شالنبرغ</orig>
Federal Minister for European and International Affairs

61

(2)Austrian nationals, who are holders of a valid
biometric diplomatic or service passport, shall
not be required to obtain a
visa to enter the territory of the State of Kuwait
for a period which does not exceed 90 (ninety)
days within a 180 (one hundred and eighty)-day
period counted from the date of entry.

## Article 2
Holders of a valid biometric diplomatic or
service passport of the Republic of Austria and
holders of a valid biometric diplomatic or special
passport of the State of Kuwait may enter into
and depart
from the territory of the other Party at any point
authorised for that purpose by the competent
immigration authorities, without any restriction
except for those stipulated in the security,
migratory, customs, sanitary entry and other
provisions which may be legally applicable to
holders of such valid passports.

## Article 3
The provisions of Article 1 of this Agreement do
not apply to persons, who are planning to stay in
the territory of the other Party for a period
longer than the one stated in Article 1, or
intending to take up employment there.

## Article 4
Nationals of either Party enjoying privileges and
immunities according to international law and
who are holders of the respective ID card issued
by the receiving country, do not need a visa or a
residence permit to stay in or to re-enter the
territory of this Party as long as this ID card is
valid and presented upon entry along with a valid
biometric diplomatic or service passport of the
Republic of Austria or a valid biometric
diplomatic or special passport of the State of
Kuwait.

## Article 5
(1)The Parties shall exchange, through
diplomatic channels, samples of the passports
according to Article 1 of this agreement used by
either Party within 30 (thirty) days after the
signing of this Agreement; and each Party shall
provide to the other Party the sample of any new
or changed diplomatic, service or special
passport within at least 30 (thirty) days before
issuing such passports.
(2)Both Parties shál' duly inform each other
about any modification introduced in their
respective national laws and regulations related
to passport issuance.
(3)If a national of either Party loses his/her valid
passport referred to in Article 1 of this
Agreement in the territory of the other Party,
he/she shall inform the competent authorities of
the receiving Party. The diplomatic mission or
consulate concerned shall issue a new passport or
travel document to the aforementioned national
and inform the competent authorities of the
receiving Party.

## Article 6
(1)This Agreement does not exempt citizens of
either Party from the obligation to respect the
laws and regulations of the other Party
concerning the entry, stay and exit of foreigners.
(2)Both Parties reserve the right to refuse
admission to or shorten the stay of persons
considered undesirable or endangering public
peace, order, health or national security.

## Article 7
Either Party may suspend this Agreement, for
reasons of public order, national security, public
health, irregular immigration, conflicts of
interests in the area of human rights and
fundamental freedoms or lack of cooperation in
the area of readmission. The suspension as well
as its termination shall be notified immediately
to the other Party through diplomatic channels.

# Decree No. 67 of 2025
## Appointing Two Non-Resident Ambassadors

- After reviewing the Constitution,
- And on the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qa'dah 1445 AH corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
- And on Law No. 21 of 1962 regarding the Diplomatic and Consular Corps System <orig>نظام السلكين الدبلوماسي والقنصلي</orig> and its amending laws,
- And on Decree No. 84 of 2024 concerning Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig>, and its amending decrees,
- And based on the proposal of the Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,

We have decreed the following:
Article One
Each of the following shall be appointed:
1- Reem Mohammed Al-Khaled <orig>ريم محمد الخالد</orig> - Ambassador of the State of Kuwait to the Federal Republic of Germany - in addition to her current duties - as non-resident Ambassador of the State of Kuwait to the Republic of Latvia.
2- Sabah Nasser Al-Malik Al-Sabah <orig>صباح ناصر المالك الصباح</orig> - Ambassador of the State of Kuwait to New Zealand - in addition to his current duties - as non-resident Ambassador of the State of Kuwait to the Cook Islands.

Article Two
The Minister of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزير الخارجية</orig> shall implement this Decree, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

*   And on Decree No. 152 of 2023 <orig>المرسوم رقم 152 لسنة 2023</orig> appointing Mr. Ziyad Abdullah Al-Najem <orig>زياد عبدالله الناجم</orig> as Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>,

*   And on the resignation letter dated 25/3/2025 submitted by the Undersecretary, Mr. Ziyad Abdullah Al-Najem <orig>زياد عبدالله الناجم</orig>, based on his desire,
*   And on the letter from the General Secretariat of the Council of Ministers <orig>الأمانة العامة لمجلس الوزراء</orig> dated 9/4/2025 regarding informing the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig> of the acceptance of the resignation of the Undersecretary, Mr. Ziyad Abdullah Al-Najem <orig>زياد عبدالله الناجم</orig>,
*   And based on the requirements of public interest,
*   And pursuant to the powers vested in us.

Decided

### Article One

The resignation of Mr. Ziyad Abdullah Al-Najem <orig>زياد عبدالله الناجم</orig> (Civil ID: 279101100036) from the position of Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> is accepted, effective from the end of the workday on 25/3/2025.

### Article Two

All concerned parties <orig>الجهات المعنية</orig> shall be notified of this decision, and necessary measures shall be taken for its implementation.

### Article Three

All officials – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this decision, which shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Minister of Commerce and Industry

# Ministry of Communications <orig>وزارة المواصلات</orig>
## Ministerial Resolution No. (22) of 2025
### Regarding Additional Capacity Subscriptions for Internet Service Providers via Fiber Optic Network

The Minister of State for Communications Affairs <orig>وزير الدولة لشؤون الاتصالات</orig>:
- After reviewing Article (130) of the Constitution;
- And Law No. (37) of 2014 establishing the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>هيئة تنظيم الاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig> and its amendment;
- And Decree-Law No. (1) of 2025 concerning Fees and Financial Costs for the Utilization of Public Facilities and Services;
- And the Amiri Decree issued on 12/8/1986 concerning the competencies of the Ministry of Communications <orig>وزارة المواصلات</orig> and its amendments;
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (329) of 2012 regarding Internet Service Tariffs via Fiber Optic Network;
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (347) of 2016 regarding Internet Service Tariffs via Fiber Optic Network;
- And the report of the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig> regarding the stimulation of Internet services via Fiber Optic Network (GPON);
- And the presentation by Mr./ Undersecretary of the Ministry of Communications <orig>وكيل وزارة المواصلات</orig> in letter No. (W.N.S./15) dated 26/1/2025;
- And Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig> Resolution No. (375) adopted at its meeting No. (2025/12)-(47) held on 26/3/2025 regarding the approval of the proposed Ministerial Resolution prepared by His Excellency the Minister of State for Communications Affairs <orig>وزير الدولة لشؤون الاتصالات</orig> concerning additional capacity subscriptions for Internet service providers via fiber optic network.

Has Decided

### Article One
For the purposes of this Resolution, the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below:

<table_caption>Definitions of Terms Related to Internet Service Capacity</table_caption>
<table>
| Term | Meaning |
|:--------|:------|
| Service Provider: | An Internet service provider licensed by the Communications and Information Technology Regulatory Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاتصالات وتقنية المعلومات</orig> to provide Internet services. |
| Existing Capacities: | The total registered capacity subscriptions for each service provider at the time of issuance of this Resolution. |
| Additional Capacities: | Capacities allocated to the service provider in addition to the existing capacities, at a rate of (1 Gbps) for each capacity allocated in accordance with the provisions of this Resolution. |
</table>

### Article Two
The provisions of this Resolution shall apply only to additional capacity subscriptions allocated to service providers starting from the effective date of this Resolution. The tariff stipulated in the aforementioned Ministerial Resolution No. (347) of 2016 shall continue to apply to existing capacity subscriptions.

### Article Three
Without prejudice to the tariff stipulated in Article One of the aforementioned Resolution (347) of 2016, the allocation value for additional capacity subscriptions for a (1 Gbps) capacity shall be (12,000) (twelve thousand Kuwaiti Dinars) K.D. annually.

### Article Four
The allocation period for the additional capacity mentioned in Article Three of this Resolution shall be one full calendar year, and its allocation fee shall be paid in advance to the Ministry of Communications <orig>وزارة المواصلات</orig>, in addition to installation charges. The allocation value shall be non-refundable.

### Article Five
For the application of the tariff mentioned in Article Three of this Resolution, it is a condition that the service provider continues to renew and does not reduce the existing capacity subscriptions for each system separately (NGN-A / NGN-B).

### Article Six
Should the service provider reduce below the existing capacities during the period of benefiting from the allocation according to the value mentioned in Article Three of this Resolution, the following effects shall ensue:
1. The provision of Article Three of this Resolution shall not apply to the service provider.
2. The value stipulated in the aforementioned Ministerial Resolution No. (347) of 2016 shall apply to all capacities.

The date of reduction below the existing capacities shall be the one adopted when conducting financial settlement.

### Article Seven
The provisions of the aforementioned Ministerial Resolution No. (347) of 2016 shall apply to matters not specifically regulated in this Resolution.

### Article Eight
This Resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall be effective from the date of its publication for a period of one year.

<footer>
Minister of State for Communications Affairs <orig>وزير الدولة لشؤون الاتصالات</orig>
Omar Saud Abdulaziz Al-Omar <orig>عمر سعود عبد العزيز العمر</orig>
Issued on: 14 April 2025 AD
</footer>

Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>

# Decision No. (60) of 2025
Regarding the License Application Submitted by Rasameel Investment Company <orig>شركة رساميل للاستثمار</orig> to Practice Securities Activities

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 <orig>القانون رقم (7) لسنة 2010</orig> Regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- And the application for a license for securities activities submitted by Rasameel Investment Company <orig>شركة رساميل للاستثمار</orig>;
- And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 <orig>القرار رقم (4) لسنة 2025</orig> Regarding the Amendment of Final Approval Powers for the Work Procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

Has decided the following:

## Article One
The Authority grants preliminary approval to Rasameel Investment Company <orig>شركة رساميل للاستثمار</orig> for licensing the activity of a securities broker not registered on the stock exchange.
This approval is valid for a period of six months, renewable, starting from 16/04/2025 and ending on 15/10/2025, for the purpose of fulfilling the criteria specified by the Authority.

## Article Two
The company mentioned in this Decision shall be licensed, after completing the requirements referred to in the preliminary approval letter issued by the Authority, for a period of three years, renewable, from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fee.

## Article Three
The competent authorities shall implement this Decision, each within its respective jurisdiction. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Issued on: 16 April 2025 AD

# Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>
## Ministerial Resolution No. (157) of 2025
Regarding the Lifting of Deprivation from Tax Exemption Privilege

Minister of Finance and Minister of State for Economic Affairs and Investment:
- Having reviewed Law No. (116) of 2013 regarding the Promotion of Direct Investment in the State of Kuwait.
- And Minister of Commerce and Industry Resolution No. (502) of 2014 issuing the Executive Regulations for Law No. (116) of 2013 regarding the Promotion of Direct Investment in the State of Kuwait.
- And Director General of Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig> Resolution No. (329) of 2019 regarding the Mechanism for Calculating Points for Evaluating Investment License Applications and Granting Privileges.
- And Director General of Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig> Resolution No. (75) of 2022 imposing an Administrative Penalty.
- And the report of the Follow-up and Audit Department, which includes the correction of the violation and the investment entity's compliance with the licensing requirements and the provisions of the aforementioned Law No. (116) of 2013.
- And the Resolution of the Board of Directors of Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig> at its meeting No. (2025/1) held on 2025/2/23.
- And based on what was presented by Mr. / Director General of Kuwait Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>.
- And in achievement of the public interest.

Has decided

### Article One

# Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>
## Correction

A material error occurred in the Ministry of Commerce and Industry's <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> announcement regarding M.S. Tex International for Ready-Made Garments <orig>ام اس تكس إنترناشيونال للملابس الجاهزة</orig> ## Company Under Liquidation <orig>الشركة تحت التصفية</orig> in Issue 1734, published on Sunday, 2025/4/13 AD, where an error appeared in the company's name.
Therefore, we are re-publishing the announcement after correcting the error.

## Announcement

The owners of M.S. Tex International for Ready-Made Garments <orig>ام اس تكس إنترناشيونال للملابس الجاهزة</orig> ## Company Under Liquidation <orig>الشركة تحت التصفية</orig> have submitted a request to the Department of Partnerships <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص</orig> at the Ministry to carry out/ dissolve and liquidate the company.
Legal Entity: One-Person Company <orig>شركة الشخص الواحد</orig>.
Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of publication of this announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection results in the continued obligation of the joint partners, in the case of a joint liability company <orig>التضامنية</orig> or a simple limited partnership <orig>التوصية البسيطة</orig> only, towards this creditor, until their objection is decided by a final judgment.

# Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>
## Announcement
Regarding the Offering of Auction No. (DA/134/2024-2025)
for Licensing the Exploitation, Management, and Operation of an Investment Site
for Providing Fresh Juices (Local) at Al-Shaheed Park <orig>حديقة الشهيد</orig>, Phase Three – Site (H2)
The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the offering of Auction No. (DA/134/2024-2025) for licensing the exploitation, management, and operation of an investment site for providing fresh juices (local) at Al-Shaheed Park <orig>حديقة الشهيد</orig>, Phase Three – Site No. (H2). Those wishing to participate, from companies or institutions specialized in this field, should apply to obtain the terms and conditions booklet and auction documents during official working hours from (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> – Bayyan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7 – Tenders and Follow-up Department) during official working hours, starting from the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette "Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>", for a non-refundable fee of (75/- K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> only (K-Net only payment) for the booklet. Owners of Small and Medium Enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> are exempted from these fees (upon submission of the relevant certificate). This is effective from Sunday, 20/4/2025, from 8:30 AM until 1:00 PM, taking into account the following:
1- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Thursday, 1/5/2025. No bids will be accepted after this time.
2- Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department – at Bayyan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7.
3- Submission of an initial security deposit of not less than (2%) of the bid value in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from one of the Kuwaiti banks, valid throughout the bid validity period of (90) days.
4- Submission of a valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage.
5- A letter of authorization and a copy of the Civil ID <orig>البطاقة المدنية</orig> for the company representative to purchase the auction document.
6- This auction is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7- The bidder must submit a letter accompanied by a copy of the registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
8- The site inspection and preliminary meeting will be held on Sunday, 27/4/2025, at 10:00 AM at Al-Shaheed Park <orig>حديقة الشهيد</orig>, Phase Three.

# Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>

# Announcement

Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> announces the offering of Auction No. (01-2025/2026) regarding the utilization and management of the first, second, third, fourth, and fifth floors with furniture in the Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> building - located in Al-Qibla <orig>القبلة</orig> area, according to the terms and specifications stated in the auction documents, which can be obtained from the Bank, Surra <orig>السرة</orig> - Financial Department - Sixth Floor.
Therefore, companies wishing to participate in the auction may obtain the general terms and specifications booklet during the following hours: from (8:00 AM until 1:00 PM) for a non-refundable fee of (K.D. 75/-) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, provided they bring the following documents:
1.  A copy of a valid Commercial Register.
2.  A copy of a valid Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة وصناعة الكويت</orig> certificate.
3.  The bidder must have a valid license issued by Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>.
4.  The bidder must submit a detailed record of the works undertaken by them relevant to the requirements, supported by authenticated certificates from the concerned authorities.
5.  The bidder must have a qualified team with professional experience and full knowledge of the nature of the required work.
6.  A letter of authorization from the company to purchase the auction documents, along with the name(s) of the authorized signatory or those authorized to contract with the Bank, and samples of their signatures.
7.  The bid must be accompanied by a preliminary bond of K.D. 2000, which shall be in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from one of the accredited banks in Kuwait in favor of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>, unconditional and valid for the duration of the bid.
8.  The site visit will be held at the Bank's building located in Al-Qibla <orig>القبلة</orig> area - on Thursday, 2025/05/08, from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM.
9.  A preliminary meeting will be held at the Bank's main building - South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> - Fifth Floor, Meeting Room, on Sunday, 2025/05/11, from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM.
10. Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope addressed to Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> and deposited in the Bank's Auction Committee box at the Financial Department of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> (South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig>) no later than 1:00 PM on Thursday, 2025/05/15.

# Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>
## Announcement

The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> announces the issuance of Practice No.: 914 for the year 2025-2026 <orig>914 لسنة 2025-2026</orig> concerning the supply, installation, inspection, delivery, warranty, training, and provision of radio messaging emergency devices and system for the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig>, in accordance with the terms and technical specifications contained in the practice documents, which can be purchased from the Ministry of Information's <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> website via the barcode attached to the announcement, starting from Sunday, 20/04/2025, for a non-refundable fee of only (K.D. 50/-) fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. Offers must be submitted to the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة مشتريات</orig> at the Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> in sealed envelopes, accompanied by an initial security deposit of (2%) of the bid value (which must be valid throughout the bid validity period of 90 days). The practice number, as indicated above, must be written on the outside of the envelope, avoiding any mention of the practitioner's name or any indication thereof. The final deadline for bid submission is 1:00 PM on Sunday, 18/05/2025.

*   The Ministry of Information <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> will hold a preliminary meeting on Tuesday, 06/05/2025, at 10:00 AM at the office of Mr. / Assistant Undersecretary for Engineering Affairs <orig>الوكيل المساعد للشئون الهندسية</orig> - Media Complex <orig>مجمع الإعلام</orig> - Al-Sour Street <orig>شارع السور</orig> - Ground Floor, to answer inquiries regarding the practice. Those who have purchased the practice documents may attend the meeting in person or through a representative. Everything recorded in the meeting minutes shall be considered an integral part of the practice documents and shall be binding on bidders. The Ministry will circulate the questions, inquiries, and their approved responses to all practitioners before the bid closing date.
*   All documents must be submitted on a non-copyable CD, 3 copies, with the exception of (the bid form, initial security deposit, a copy of the purchase receipt, and the practitioner's data form).
*   The practice is indivisible, and alternative offers will not be accepted.
*   This announcement serves as an invitation for practitioners wishing to attend the bid opening session, after coordination with the Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig> before the scheduled date for the bid opening session.
*   A valid National Labor Compliance Certificate <orig>شهادة استيفاء العمالة الوطنية</orig> issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> must be submitted with the bid. Bids that do not include this certificate will be excluded.
*   The bidder must attach a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate <orig>شهادة لمن يهمه الأمر</orig> issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the practitioner's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority due to any of the violations mentioned in Article 10 of Law No. 6 of 2010 <orig>القانون رقم 6 لسنة 2010</orig> concerning work in the private sector. Bids that do not include this certificate will be excluded.
*   Owners of Small and Medium Enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> are exempt from the prescribed fees for purchasing documents, in accordance with the text of Article 39 of Law No. 74 of 2019 <orig>قانون رقم 2019/74</orig> regarding amendments to Law No. 49 of 2016 <orig>قانون رقم 49 لسنة 2016</orig>.
*   Owners of Small and Medium Enterprises <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> wishing to apply for the practice must attach a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Care and Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise with the fund.
*   This announcement is considered an integral part of the practice documents.
*   To obtain a copy, the practitioner must register and pay the fees through the website https://eservice.media.gov.kw/purchase

# Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>
## Announcement

The owners of Amal Daycare for Children Company <orig>شركة أمل لدور حضانة الأطفال النهارية</orig> ## Company Under Liquidation <orig>الشركة تحت التصفية</orig> have submitted a request to the Department of Partnerships <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص</orig> at the Ministry to carry out: Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company. Legal Entity: One-Person Company <orig>شركة الشخص الواحد</orig>. Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of publication of this announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection shall result in the continued obligation of the joint partners, in the case of a general partnership or simple limited partnership only, towards this creditor, until a final judgment is rendered on their objection.

K.S.C. (Closed), at the company's headquarters located in the Ministries Area, Block 1, in the main meeting hall of the Public Services Building, 3rd Floor.
The esteemed shareholders at the meeting approved that Mr. Anwar Talal Al-Fadhli <orig>أنور طلال الفضلي</orig> – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors – would chair the meeting session.
Also present at the meeting were:
- Ms. Afrah Ali Al-Sharafi <orig>أفراح علي الشرفي</orig> – Board Secretary – (Meeting Secretary).
- Shareholders holding 139,337,419 shares (in person and by proxy), representing 99.998% of the total paid-up capital shares of the company, which number 139,347,000 shares.
After the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was announced, Mr. Anwar Talal Al-Fadhli <orig>أنور طلال الفضلي</orig> – Chairman of the meeting session – opened the meeting by welcoming the esteemed attendees, then proceeded to present the items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting for discussion, and the following was accomplished:-
Item One: The amendment of Article (13) of the Articles of Association was approved as follows:
- Current Text:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of five members, elected by the General Assembly by secret ballot, and any shareholder, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors in proportion to their shareholding therein, and the number of Board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board members to be elected, and shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in the election of the remaining Board members, except to the extent exceeding the percentage used in appointing their representatives to the Board of Directors, and a group of shareholders may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives for them on the Board of Directors in proportion to their combined ownership, and these representatives shall have the rights and duties of elected members, and the shareholder shall be responsible for the actions of their representatives towards the company, its entity, and its shareholders.
Amounts due for representation on the company's Board of Directors shall accrue to public institutions, public bodies, and wholly state-owned companies, and the Chairman of the Board of Directors must pay these amounts directly to those entities within one week from their due date, and the aforementioned entities may determine the remunerations and salaries they disburse to their representatives on the company's Board of Directors.
Membership in the company's Board of Directors shall not be included within the maximum number of memberships, and a person may be the chairman of the board of directors of more than one closed shareholding company, and the company may have a Chief Executive Officer from among the Board members or from outside, and Board members shall be elected by secret ballot at the General Assembly meeting, and a Board member may dispose of their shares in the company during their membership on the Board, without prejudice to the restrictions on share disposal stipulated in Companies Law No. 25 of 2012 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 25 لسنة 2012</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.
- Text After Amendment:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (3) members, from whom the entity or entities entitled to appoint representatives to the Board of Directors shall appoint members in proportion to their ownership in the company's capital, and the remaining members shall be elected by secret ballot.
Finally, the Chairman of the meeting thanked the esteemed attendees, and accordingly, the proceedings of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting concluded at 12:00 AM on the same day.
Chairman of the Board of Directors

Item Two: Approval of the Board of Directors' proposal to increase the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital in kind, in accordance with the asset valuation report prepared by Messrs./ BDO Economic, Administrative, Industrial, and Computer Consulting and Opening Private Training Institutes (L.L.C.) <orig>شركة BDO للاستشارات الاقتصادية والادارية والصناعية والكمبيوتر وفتح المعاهد التدريبية الأهلية (ذ.م.م)</orig>, so that the increase in the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital shall be from KWD 2,100,000 (Two Million One Hundred Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars) distributed over 21,000,000 shares, with a par value of 100 fils per share, to KWD 23,286,942 (Twenty-Three Million Two Hundred Eighty-Six Thousand Nine Hundred Forty-Two Kuwaiti Dinars) distributed over 232,869,420 shares, with a par value of 100 fils per share, with an increase of KWD 21,186,942 (Twenty-One Million One Hundred Eighty-Six Thousand Nine Hundred Forty-Two Kuwaiti Dinars) distributed over 211,869,420 shares, with a par value of 100 fils per share, allocated to existing shareholders.
Approved unanimously

And the transfer of ownership of 99% of the partners' shares in Ajial Contracting and General Trading Company <orig>شركة أجيال للمقاولات والتجارة العامة</orig> and Al-Othman and Al-Bisher Trading Company <orig>شركة العثمان والبشر للتجارة</orig> with a value of KWD 21,186,942 in favor of Ajial Holding Company <orig>شركة أجيال القابضة</orig>.

Item Four: Amendment of Article No. (8) of the Company's Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association as follows:

# Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1735, Seventy-First Year
</header>
K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>م. ك. مقفلة</orig>
### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

On Monday, March 24, 2025, at 11:30 AM, the shareholders of Al-Ra'eda for Petrochemicals Company <orig>الشركة الرائدة للبتروكيماويات</orig> – a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed) <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة</orig> – convened under the chairmanship of Mr. Hussein Fahad Al-Fahad <orig>حسين فهد الفهد</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors, at the Kuwait Industrial Bank <orig>بنك الكويت الصناعي</orig> building – 10th Floor.
In addition to the shareholders, the following gentlemen attended the session:
*   The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> was notified of the date of the company's General Assembly meeting, and the Ministry confirmed its awareness of the meeting date by virtue of the extract attached to these minutes.
*   The Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig> apologized for not attending.

After the quorum was met with the attendance of 2,500,000 shares, in person and by proxy, representing 100% of the company's 2,500,000 shares with a capital of KWD 250,000, the discussion of the agenda items commenced. The Extraordinary General Assembly unanimously approved these items as follows:

1.  The future of the company was discussed as follows:
    *   The capital will be increased by KWD 250,000 in cash.
    *   The benevolent loan <orig>القرض الحسن</orig> will be converted into capital with a value of KWD 153,000.
    *   Creditor balances and other credit balances amounting to KWD 9,805,990 will be written off.
    *   The legal reserve <orig>الاحتياطي القانوني</orig> of KWD 2,362 will be utilized to amortize part of the accumulated losses.
    *   The amortization of accumulated losses amounting to KWD 416,967 was discussed and proposed, which will lead to a reduction of capital to KWD 250,000 after the amortization of losses. The amortization of accumulated losses reflects a fundamental step to correct the company's financial position and enable it to resume its operations without the burden of previous losses.

2.  The increase of the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 250,000 (Two Hundred and Fifty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars) to KWD 653,000 (Six Hundred and Fifty-Three Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars) by an amount of KWD 403,000 (Four Hundred and Three Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars), with a share value of 100 Kuwaiti Fils, was approved through the following:
    a. A cash increase of KWD 250,000 (Two Hundred and Fifty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars) allocated to current shareholders registered in the company's books up to the date of the General Assembly meeting, and authorizing the Board of Directors to set controls and conditions for capital calls and the disposal of fractional shares.
    b. An increase through the creditors' account of KWD 153,000 (One Hundred and Fifty-Three Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars), with the principal debt being cash, allocated to one of the company's shareholders, namely Kuwait Industrial Projects Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمشروعات الصناعية</orig>.

3.  The amendment of Article (5) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> and Article (6) of the Memorandum of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> was approved to read as follows:

**Text Before Amendment:**
"The company's capital is set at KWD 250,000 (Two Hundred and Fifty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars), distributed over 2,500,000 shares (Two Million Five Hundred Thousand Shares), with each share valued at 100 Kuwaiti Fils, and all shares are cash shares."

**Text After Amendment:**
"The company's authorized and issued capital is set at KWD 653,000 (Six Hundred and Fifty-Three Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars), distributed over 6,530,000 shares (Six Million Five Hundred and Thirty Thousand Shares), with each share valued at 100 Kuwaiti Fils, and all shares are cash shares." "The company's paid-up capital is set at KWD 403,000 (Four Hundred and Three Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars), distributed over 4,030,000 shares (Four Million Thirty Thousand Shares), with each share valued at 100 Kuwaiti Fils, and all shares are cash shares." This is subject to the approval of the regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>.

The meeting concluded at 12:30 PM on the same date of its convening.

Chairman of the Board of Directors / Chairman of the Session

## Al-Qurain for Car Trading Company <orig>شركة القرين لتجارة السيارات</orig>
### Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed) <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية (مقفلة)</orig>
### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
### Held on Thursday, February 19, 2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Al-Qurain for Car Trading Company <orig>شركة القرين لتجارة السيارات</orig>, a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed) <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية (مقفلة)</orig>, held its extraordinary meeting at 10:00 AM on Wednesday, February 19, 2025, at the company's headquarters located in Old Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ القديم</orig> area, Third Street, Plot No. 16, opposite the new Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig> showroom.
The meeting was held under the chairmanship of Mr. Ahmed Abdulaziz Ali Al-Mutawa <orig>أحمد عبد العزيز علي المطوع</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer – and the following also attended the meeting:
*   Representing Al-Bisher Legal Group <orig>مجموعة البشر القانونية</orig> – Mr. Ahmed Fahad Al-Duaij <orig>أحمد فهد الدعيج</orig>.
*   Shareholders holding 314,685,130 shares, in person and by proxy, representing 82.503% of the total share capital of the company, which amounts to 157,950,792 shares, after excluding treasury shares.

After the announcement of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, Mr. Ahmed Abdulaziz Ali Al-Mutawa <orig>أحمد عبد العزيز علي المطوع</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer – opened the meeting session, welcoming the attendees, and then proceeded to present the items on the Extraordinary General Assembly's agenda for discussion.
The following was done:

1.  Mr. Chairman of the Board of Directors and CEO reviewed the letter received from the Public Authority for Investment <orig>هيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> by Mr. Saud Hadhel Salem Al-Khalawi <orig>سعود هاضل سالم الخلاوي</orig> – a request to provide the Public Authority for Investment with the necessary reports regarding the listing of Al-Qurain for Car Trading Company <orig>شركة القرين لتجارة السيارات</orig> on the Kuwait Stock Exchange <orig>سوق الكويت للأوراق المالية</orig> for their review and study and to make an appropriate decision thereon. Accordingly, the Assembly agreed to postpone the discussion of items one and two of the attached agenda for two months from this date, provided that another meeting is called to discuss the same two items on April 19, 2025, and make an appropriate decision regarding them.

2.  For item three, the Assembly approved the amendment of the text of Article (5) of the Memorandum of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and the text of Article (4) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> to comply with the requirements of the International Standard Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC) <orig>الكود الدولي للأنشطة التجارية</orig>.

**(Text Before Amendment)**
*   The purposes for which the company was established are:
    1.  Importing, exporting, selling, and maintaining cars and their spare parts.
    2.  Representing car companies and obtaining their agencies.
    3.  Importing and exporting industrial and heavy machinery and equipment. The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities or be affiliated with them.
    4.  Activity of importing and selling chemical materials, including special car batteries

## Item One: Discussion of the amendment of Article (5) of the Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article (4) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> concerning the purposes for which the company was established.

### Current Text:
The purposes for which the company was established are:
1- Owning shares in Kuwaiti or foreign joint-stock companies, as well as owning shares or stakes in Kuwaiti or foreign limited liability companies, or participating in the establishment of both types of these companies, managing them, and guaranteeing them to third parties.
2- Lending to companies in which it owns shares and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than 20% at least.
3- Owning industrial property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, or any other related rights, and leasing them to other companies for exploitation, whether inside or outside Kuwait.
4- Owning the necessary contracts and real estate for carrying out its activities within the limits permitted by law.
5- Utilizing the financial surpluses available to the company by investing them in financial and real estate portfolios managed by specialized companies.
The company may carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either directly or by agency. The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities or that assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with these entities.

### Text After Amendment:
The purposes for which the company was established are:
1) Holding company activities – Code No. (642000)
2) Managing its subsidiary companies or participating in the management of other companies in which it holds shares and providing the necessary support to them – Code No. (642010)
3) Investing its funds in trading shares, bonds, and other securities – Code No. (642020)
4) Owning the necessary real estate and contracts for carrying out its work within the limits permitted by law – Code No. (642030)
5) Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than twenty percent – Code No. (642040)
6) Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiary holding companies and others – Code No. (642050)
7) Owning shares for the company's account only – Code No. (642051)
8) Office for managing holding activities – Code No. (642070)
The company may carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either directly or by agency. The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities or that assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with these entities.

2.38% of the total attending shares abstained from voting on this item.

## Announcement
The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig>) announces the offering of the following practices:

<table_caption>Medical Supply Tender Details</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Practice No. | Description | Fees | Closing Date |
|:--|:---|:-----|:------|:---|
| 1 | 5DI009      | Paper bed sheets for medical examination, size 85x150cm, specifically for departments in health centers and hospitals | 1000  | 90 days from the announcement date and more |
</table>

Bids shall be placed in the bid box at the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig>. Bids must be valid for a period of (90 days) from the closing date. Companies wishing to participate in the practice must meet the following conditions:
1- Local companies must be registered with the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> in the suppliers' register.
2- Local companies must specialize in the medical field, as evidenced by a certified certificate from the Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
3- When submitting two offers, two booklets must be purchased with different receipts.
4- Attach a valid product registration certificate from the Department of Registration and Control of Medical and Herbal Drugs <orig>إدارة التسجيل ومراقبة الأدوية الطبية والنباتية</orig>, or proof of submission of the certificate, and a copy of the manufacturer's and material's registration in the suppliers' register at the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> as part of the bid contents (specific to drug control).
5- Provide samples of new materials, whether a new product requested for the first time or from a new manufacturer, for specific control (drugs - medical supplies).
6- Attach a national labor support percentage certificate.
7- Practice documents can be obtained from the official website of the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.
8- The fees for purchasing the booklet can be paid through the website to accompany the practice documents.
9- Submit price offers in a sealed envelope, including practice documents, according to the closing date specified on the official website of the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>.

Announcement

The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Medical Engineering Department <orig>إدارة الهندسة الطبية</orig> - Laboratories Control <orig>مراقبة المختبرات</orig>) announces the offering of the following practices:

<table_caption>Medical Engineering Department - Laboratories Control Tenders</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Practice No. | Description | Fees | Closing Date | Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig> Note |
|:--|:---|:------|:------|:---|:---|
| 1 | 5LB088      | Blood bags for Central Blood Bank <orig>بنك الدم المركزي</orig> printer / Stock materials | 75    | Two weeks from announcement date | More information on the Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> website |
</table>

Bids shall be placed in the bid box at the Medical Engineering Department <orig>إدارة الهندسة الطبية</orig>, New Building, and bids shall be valid for a period of (90 days) from the closing date.
Companies wishing to participate in the practice must meet the following conditions:
1) Participation is restricted to companies registered with the Medical Engineering Department <orig>إدارة الهندسة الطبية</orig>.
2) The company must specialize in this field, with proof thereof.
3) Payment of the prescribed fees for purchasing practice documents electronically.
4) A letter of authorization from the company to purchase practice documents.
5) Participating companies must submit a national labor support certificate.
6) Practice documents can be obtained from the publication date for 14 days only.

Announcement

| 2 | 5TN089      | Supply, installation, maintenance, and warranty of DEFIBRILLATOR WITH CRASH CART devices and their accessories for the Ministerial Committee for Cardiology Departments and Units, Salman Al-Dabbous Cardiac Center <orig>مركز سلمان الدبوس للقلب</orig> | 75    | One month from announcement date |

Bids shall be placed in the bid box at the Medical Engineering Department <orig>إدارة الهندسة الطبية</orig> (No. 2), and bids shall be valid for a period of (90 days) from the closing date. 1) Participation is restricted to companies registered with the Medical Engineering Department <orig>إدارة الهندسة الطبية</orig>.
2) The company must specialize in this field, with proof thereof.

Announcement

The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> (Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> - Drug Control <orig>مراقبة الأدوية</orig>) announces the offering of the following practices:

<table_caption>Medical Warehouses Department - Drug Control Tenders</table_caption>
<table>
| No. | Practice No. | Description | Fees | Closing Date |
|:----|:---|:------|:------|:---|
| 1   | 4IN473      | Injections for eczema treatment, specifically for all hospitals | 3500  | 30 days from announcement date and more |
| 2   | 4IN418      | Corticosteroid injection medication, specifically for all hospitals | 150   | 30 days from announcement date and more |
| 3   | 4IN475      | Intravenous feeding solutions, specifically for all hospitals | 150   | 30 days from announcement date and more |
</table>

Bids shall be placed in the bid box at the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig>, and bids shall be valid for a period of (90 days) from the closing date.
Companies wishing to participate in the practice must meet the following conditions:
1) Local companies must be registered with the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> in the suppliers' register.
2) Local companies must specialize in the medical field and be documented with a certified certificate from the Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
3) When submitting two offers, two booklets must be purchased with different receipts.
4) Attach a valid product registration certificate from the Medical Drug Registration and Control Department <orig>إدارة التسجيل ومراقبة الأدوية الطبية</orig> or proof of submission of the certificate, and a copy of the manufacturer's and material's registration in the suppliers' register at the Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات</orig> within the contents of the submitted bid (specific to Drug Control <orig>مراقبة الأدوية</orig>).
5) Submission of samples for new materials, whether a new product requested for the first time or from a new manufacturer, for the relevant control (Drugs - Medical Supplies).
6) Attach a national labor support percentage certificate.

### Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>
Held on 23/3/2025, Session No. 10

After reviewing the submitted requests for amending data in the birth and death registers, it was decided to proceed with amending the birth and death registers. Birth and death certificates will be issued after fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement. The amendment will be made in the registers, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment:

The Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/1969 <orig>القانون رقم 69/36</orig> and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021 <orig>القرار الوزاري رقم 2021/1650</orig>, met.
*   Dr. / Head of the General Medical Council <orig>المجلس الطبي العام</orig> - Chairman
*   Mr. / Head of Registration Department <orig>قسم القيد</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Legal Researcher <orig>الباحث القانوني</orig> - Member

Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>
Held on 23/3/2025, Committee Session No. 10

Ms. Alia Al-Saffar <orig>علياء الصفار</orig> acted as the Committee's Secretary.
The Committee reviewed requests from No. (((128))) to No. (((142))) in the attached list concerning data amendments in birth and death registers for dropped birth and death registration requests.
The legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement has expired, and no objection has been submitted to the authorities concerned with the registers. Birth and death certificates will be issued.

Supervisor of Sales Center

# Announcement of Real Estate Public Auction

The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the public auction of the property described below, on Thursday, 15/5/2025, in Hall 52, Second Floor, Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل</orig>, at 9:00 AM, in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 2022/6 Sales/3 <orig>بيوع/3</orig>.
Filed by: Aziz Haidar Hassan Al-Hamr <orig>عزيز حيدر حسن الحمر</orig>.
Against:
1- Haitham Abbas Yaqoub Al-Aryan <orig>هيثم عباس يعقوب العريان</orig>.
2- Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>.

## First: Property Description: According to the attached Description Certificate

- Property Document No. 2017/6231 in Al-Khiran <orig>الخيران</orig> area - Plot 378 - Block 7 - from Plan No. 35404 - with an area of 600 m2.
* Note:
- There are major violations on the roof with an area of 2m2, violation report No. 12697 dated 2/5/2024.

* Inspection:
The property subject of the lawsuit is located at the site of the dispute in the new Al-Khiran <orig>الخيران</orig> residential area, Block (7) - Street (720) - House (12) Plot (378), Automated Number: 21124504, with Document No. 2017/6231, with an area of 600m2. The inspection was conducted in the presence and under the guidance of the defendant and Mr. Sa'ad Al-Mutairi <orig>سعد المطيري</orig>, the knowledge expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> sought by the administration, while the plaintiff failed to attend. The inspection was carried out as follows:
- The property subject of the lawsuit is a newly constructed private residence located on one street and an alleyway, consisting of three floors with Sigma facades, central air conditioning, and an elevator.
- The ground floor consists of: a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> with its bathroom, a hall, 4 bedrooms, a kitchen, and a maid's room with its bathroom, and it is independent.
- The first floor consists of: a hall, 6 bedrooms, 5 bathrooms, and a kitchen, and it is not independent.
- The second floor consists of two apartments (Apartment No. 1 consists of a hall, a kitchen, 3 rooms, and 3 bathrooms) and (Apartment No. 2 consists of a hall, a kitchen, 4 rooms, and 4 bathrooms), and it is not independent.
- Mr. Sa'ad Al-Mutairi <orig>سعد المطيري</orig>, the knowledge expert <orig>خبير الدراية</orig>, took all his observations in preparation for estimating the property's value.

## Second: Auction Terms:

1.  First: The auction shall start with a base price of 210,600 K.D. (Two Hundred Ten Thousand Six Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
2.  Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees immediately upon the sale session.
3.  Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be resumed at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
4.  Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be resumed in the same session based on this new price.
5.  Fifth: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be resumed at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by the deposit of its full value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any decrease in the property's price.
6.  Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
7.  Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
8.  Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance of its condition.

Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the expropriated owner is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

Property Description: As stated in the Municipality's <orig>البلدية</orig> property description certificate.
An undivided share of 50% in property No. 2014/3931 located in Saad Al-Abdullah <orig>سعد العبدالله</orig> area – Plot (755), Block No. (8) in plan 38797 – with a total area of 400m2, to be sold by public auction with a base price of 155,000 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig> (One Hundred Fifty-Five Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) for the share offered for auction.
** There are violations in the property, consisting of an additional building on the ground and first floors, and report No. 81769 was filed.
** According to the expert's report
The disputed property located in Saad Al-Abdullah <orig>سعد العبد الله</orig> area – Block 8, Street 893 – House 9 – Plot 755 – and the inspection was conducted as follows:

## Secondly: Auction Terms:
### Firstly:
The auction shall commence at the basic price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by means of a certified check from the drawee bank or by means of a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
### Secondly:
Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
### Thirdly:
If the person whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be resumed in the same session based on the price at which the sale was concluded.
### Fourthly:
If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session who accepts to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a full deposit in the auction. In this case, the bidding shall be resumed in the same session based on this price.
### Fifthly:
If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be resumed at their expense based on the price at which it was previously awarded.

## Sixthly:
In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the property transfer and registration fees, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
## Seventhly:
This announcement shall be published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall be responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>الحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
## Eighthly:
The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
### Notice:
1.  This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2.  The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3.  The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose ownership has been dispossessed is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction shall commence with a base price of 245,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ألف د.ك</orig> (Two Hundred Forty-Five Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must fully deposit the approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be re-opened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be re-opened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be re-opened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value.
The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and property registration fees, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.

Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance of its condition.
