3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the expropriated owner is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by operation of law, and the bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

## Second: Auction Terms:

**First:** The auction shall commence at the basic price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.

**Second:** The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.

**Third:** If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be resumed in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.

**Fourth:** If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be resumed in the same session based on this new price.

**Fifth:** If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately resume at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

**Sixth:** In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and property registration fees, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.

**Seventh:** This announcement is published in accordance with the law and at the request of those directly involved in the sale procedures, and at their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.

**Eighth:** The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance.

- 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
- 2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
- 3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Third: If the bidder whose bid was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the auction shall be re-held at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was concluded.

Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the auction shall be re-held in the same session based on this new price.

Fifth: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the auction shall be immediately re-held at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by the deposit of its full value shall be considered.

Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for property transfer and registration, execution procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.

Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Department of Clerks <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.

Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent <orig>أجرة المثل</orig>."

1- Ahmed Mustafa Karam Hussein <orig>احمد مصطفى كرم حسين</orig>.

On 20/4/2022, we moved to the disputed site located in Al-Surra <orig>السرة</orig> area, Block 4 <orig>قطعة 4</orig> – Street 6 – Building 38, in the presence of the plaintiff's agent, the defendant's agent, and the opponents' agent (who were absent despite proper notification), and in the presence of Mr. Sami Al-Barouda <orig>سامي البارودة</orig>, the expert. - The property subject to the dispute is a private residence located on two streets (corner plot). The exterior cladding is also Sigma, and its area is 770 m2. It has two entrances and a garage, consists of a ground floor and a first floor, and has a single facade setback.

# Announcement of Sale by Sealed Bid Auction
## Auction No. (2461)

The Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> announces the sale of devices - computers - iPads - printers - computer screens - imaging devices - keyboards and other miscellaneous items no longer in use by the Kuwait Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> through a sealed bid auction according to the following details:
1- Location for receiving the terms and conditions booklet and participation offer: Kuwait Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> – West Mishref <orig>غرب مشرف</orig> – Main Road – Second Floor – Financial Affairs Department – Revenue Section – Room No. (227), from 20/4/2025 – 24/4/2025. Documents are handed over for a non-refundable fee of (30) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> payable at the Kuwait Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> fund.
The bidder will sign a declaration and undertaking upon receiving the terms and conditions booklet to adhere to the specified deadline for submitting the bid to the Central Sales Committee <orig>لجنة البيع المركزي</orig> at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>.
2- Inspection Date: (5) working days starting from 20/4/2025 – 24/4/2025. Inspection Time: During official working hours.
3- Location for those wishing to inspect: Al-Rai Workshops Complex <orig>مجمع الورش بالري</orig> – Dirt Yard Warehouse.
4- Date and Place for Submitting Bids and Opening Envelopes:
*   Bid submission on Sunday, 27/4/2025, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig> – Block 12 – Third Floor – General Storage Affairs Department – Central Sales Section <orig>قسم البيع المركزي</orig>, according to the appointment set for the bidder by the Kuwait Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء العام</orig> (no bid will be accepted after the bidder's specified deadline).
*   Envelope opening and auction holding on Monday, 28/4/2025, at the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> – Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig> – Block 12 – Third Floor – General Storage Affairs Department.

*   The bidder must attach a valid "to whom it may concern" certificate issued by the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy / Wizarat Al-Kahraba' wal-Ma' wal-Taqah Al-Mutajaddidah <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> stating clearance from consumption debts.
    The practice is open to all companies and specialized establishments in the required works, registered with the Public Authority for Sport / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma lil-Riyadha <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> and the Central Agency for Public Tenders / Al-Jihaz Al-Markazi lil-Munakasat Al-Amma <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> for the year 2025, for a fee of (75 K.D.) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, payable via K-Net (non-refundable except in cases stipulated by Ministry of Finance / Wizarat Al-Maliya <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> circulars), bringing the following:
    1- A copy of the practice announcement in the Official Gazette / Al-Jarida Al-Rasmiya <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
    2- A copy of the company's registration with the Authority for the year 2025.
    3- A written letter of authorized delegation to the Authority, accompanied by (a copy of the Civil ID card and a copy of the signature authorization).
*   Owners of small and medium enterprises (SMEs) are exempted from the prescribed fees for purchasing practice documents, in accordance with the text of Article (39) of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. 49/2016.
*   Owners of small and medium enterprises wishing to apply for the practice must attach with their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development and Care / Al-Sunduq Al-Watani li-Ri'ayat wa Tanmiyat Al-Mashru'at Al-Saghira wal-Mutawassita <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, including their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise with the Fund, in accordance with the text of Article (48) of Public Tenders Law No. (49 of 2016), which states: "Bid envelopes shall be opened at the time and place specified in the practice documents in a public session in the presence of bidders or their representatives."
*   This announcement serves as an invitation for interested practitioners to attend, as interested companies have the right to coordinate with the competent committee before the session date to attend the bid opening session.
*   This announcement is an integral part of the practice documents.
    Note: The Authority may cancel the practice without stating reasons and without any objection from the practitioners.
*   For more information, please visit the Public Authority for Sport / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma lil-Riyadha <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> website (Pas.gov.kw).

# Ordinary General Assembly
## Article (8)
The capital owner is exclusively responsible for the following matters:
1.  Amending the company's articles of association.
2.  Dissolving and liquidating the company.
3.  Merging, converting, or splitting the company.
4.  Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.
5.  Dismissing the company's manager, or restricting their authority.
Subject to the provisions of merger, conversion, and split stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017, and its executive regulations, the aforementioned decisions shall be effective upon their registration in the Commercial Register without the need for formal notarization.

# Company Accounts
## Article (9)
The company's fiscal year begins in January and ends in December each year, with the exception of the first fiscal year, which starts from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register and ends on the specified date for the end of the following fiscal year.

# Company Capital
## Article (5)
The company's capital is set at 31,000 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> ("only thirty-one thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>"), with a total of 100 cash shares. The value of one cash share is 310 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> ("only three hundred and ten Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>") and is indivisible.

# Management and Right to Sign
## Article (6)
The company shall be managed by the capital owner, personally if a natural person, or by their representative if a legal entity.

<table_caption>Company Owner/Manager Details <orig>بيانات المالك</orig></table_caption>
<table>
| Mr. | Partner / Non-Partner | Nationality | ID Number    | Address              |
|:----|:----------------------|:------------|:-------------|:---------------------|
| Amr Haitham Hussein Bibi <orig>عمرو هيثم حسين بيبي</orig> | Non-Partner           | Kuwaiti     | 280110301364 | Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> |
</table>

The company may appoint one or more managers to represent it before the judiciary and in dealings with third parties. The manager shall be responsible for its management before the owner, and the decision to appoint the manager shall not be effective until it is registered in the Commercial Register.

## Article (7)
The manager represents the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, and has the broadest authority to deal on its behalf and conclude all contracts and transactions falling within the company's objectives. Specifically, this includes appointing, suspending, and dismissing the company's agents and employees, determining their salaries, wages, and bonuses, receiving and paying amounts, signing and concluding all contracts, agreements, and deals related to the company's transactions or falling within its objectives. They also have the right to open company accounts or individual accounts (appointed by the capital owner) and the right to open bank accounts.
The company manager shall exercise the diligence of a prudent person in exercising their powers and competencies. The manager shall be jointly liable towards the company or third parties for violating the provisions of the law and the provisions of these articles or for errors in management, in accordance with the rules stipulated in the chapter on joint-stock companies in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017, and its executive regulations.
The company manager may not undertake the management of another competing company or a company with similar objectives, or contract with the company for their own account or for the account of a third party, unless with permission issued by

# Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company
## Article (10)
The company shall also be dissolved – and insofar as it does not conflict with the nature of a single-person company – for one of the reasons stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017, and its executive regulations.
The dissolution of the company must be publicized, and the dissolution of the company shall not be invoked against third parties except from the date of publication.
The company manager must follow up on the implementation of this procedure.

## Article (11)
The liquidation of the company's assets upon its dissolution for any reason shall be carried out in accordance with the provisions contained in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017, and its executive regulations.

## Article (12)
The owner shall be liable with their private assets for the company's obligations in the following cases:
a) If they, in bad faith, dispose of it or cease its activity before the expiry of its term, or before achieving the purpose for which it was established.
b) If they fail to separate their financial liability from the company's financial liability.
c) If they conduct business on behalf of the company before it acquires legal personality.

## Article (13)
All papers, contracts, publications, advertisements, correspondence, and other documents issued by the company must bear its trade name, a statement of its legal form, its registration number in the Commercial Register, a statement of the amount of capital and the paid-up portion thereof, and be followed by the phrase "Single Person Company (SPC) <orig>شركة الشخص الواحد (ش.ش.و)</orig>".

## Article (14)
The company – in matters not mentioned in these articles – shall be subject to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017, and its executive regulations.

## Article (15)
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's main office and on its website.

Based on Article (19) of Municipality Resolution No. (161/2009) regarding the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig> to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel the classification, and the committee stipulated in Article (1) of this regulation may issue its decision thereon after fulfilling the following two conditions:
1- The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2- Fifteen (15) days have elapsed from the date of publication of this request in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
The cancellation of the license or registration entails the refund of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this resolution.
Accordingly, the Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig> appeals to anyone who has any claims against the aforementioned contractor regarding building contracting agreements concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial attachments in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the contracting agreement, to review the Contractors Department <orig>قسم المقاولين</orig> at the Engineering Systems Department <orig>إدارة الأنظمة الهندسية</orig> within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig> will not consider any claims submitted after the prescribed period.

# Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>
## Announcement
Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> announces the re-issuance of Practice No. (40-2025/2024) concerning the maintenance and upgrade of the electronic door system for all branches of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>. Interested parties wishing to submit their bids should visit the Bank to purchase the booklet of terms and technical specifications for the aforementioned practice, according to the details specified below:

### Submitted Bid Conditions
The bidder must submit a technical offer and a financial offer in two sealed envelopes, one for the technical offer and the other for the financial offer, ensuring that a copy of the bid is attached on a flash drive, in accordance with the following conditions:
- The technical envelope must contain the following:
  - Initial security deposit in the form of an unconditional, unreserved, and irrevocable letter of guarantee for the amount of (K.D. 2,000 <orig>2000 د.ك</orig>) "only two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars", issued by one of the banks accredited by the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in the name and for the benefit of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig>. This security deposit must be valid for at least three months from the last date for receiving bids. Any bid not accompanied by the full amount of this security deposit will be excluded. Initial security deposits may not be refunded until (90) ninety days have passed from the closing date of the practice or when the winning bidder submits the final security deposit and signs the contract, unless the practice is cancelled. Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> will not pay any interest on the amount of this security deposit, and the bidder's creditors may not seize its amount.
- General and special conditions and technical data for the submitted offer.
- Complete data on Kuwaiti subcontractors or individuals who may be assigned part of the execution if required by the practice documents.
- Any other documents or data that may be required by the practice documents.
- The financial envelope must contain the following:
  - Bid format approved by the bidder.
  - Price lists and bills of quantities.
  - Any other elements that may affect the financial value of the offer as required by the tender conditions.
  - Any other documents or data required by the practice documents.
